Server.Name: register
Server.ShortString: (Admin Only) Registers this server with the PokeTrainer bot.
Server.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/register**

When this command is run, the current channel will be marked as an event channel. This means any public events or notifications from PokeTrainer will be sent to this channel. If you wish to change which channel events take place, look into the **/swapchannel** command.

NOTE: Your server will be automatically deregistered if the bot is missing the following permissions:
- Manage Webhooks
- Send Messages
- Send/Create/Manage Threads
- Embed Links
- Add Reactions
- Manage Messages
- Read Message History

Server.Name: server
Server.ShortString: (Admin Only) Prints the current server settings.
Server.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/server**

This command will return the details of the server settings for the bot. This includes the server name, registered event channel, and the current event taking place (if applicable).

Server.Name: unregister
Server.ShortString: (Admin Only) Unregister this server from the PokeTrainer bot events.
Server.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/unregister**

This command will remove your server from being able to receive public events and notifications. If you wish to receive public events again, look into the **/register** command.

Trainers will still be able to interact with PokeTrainer as long as it is in the server, regardless of registration.

Server.Name: swapchannel
Server.ShortString: (Admin Only) Change the current event channel of the server.
Server.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/swapchannel**

This command will change the channel in which events and public notifications gets sent, to the current channel. You can see the current event channel by using the **/server** command.

Your server must be registered with the bot by using the **/register** command in order to swap event channels and have events occur in your server.
If you wish to turn the events off, please use the **/unregister** command.

Trainer.Name: starter
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/starter**

This command will start the trainers journey, giving them the starter Pokemon of their choosing as well as $500 and 5 Pokeballs. Trainers will begin with 50 Health, but no Potions. Use **/trainer** to view your stats and inventory as well as **/shop** to buy a variety Pokeballs and Potions!

Trainer.Name: badges
Trainer.ShortString: Displays a list of your obtained badges.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/badges *[region]* *[images]* *[@user]***
Parameters:
**region** - (Optional) The region in which to filter your badge list.
**images** - (Optional) Display badge images instead of a list.
**@user** - (Optional) View another server members badge progress.

This command is used to display the current badge progress of either the specified user, or the user issuing the command. This will only display a list of obtained badges, which can be filtered by region (Kanto, Johto, etc.) and displayed in an image or text-based format. By default, the list displays in a text-based order of gyms by region (i.e. Boulder, Cascade, Thunder, etc.). To obtain more badges, use the **/gymbattle** command to fight gym leaders.

Trainer.Name: changezone
Trainer.ShortString: Change the type of Pokemon you see during a spawn.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/changezone *[zone]***
Parameters:
**zone** - The zone in which to explore for wild Pokemon.

This command is used to change a trainers search zone when **/spawn**ing wild Pokemon. There are 18 different zones, all specifying two separate types. While you have a zone active, only Pokemon with these typings can spawn

Ex. If you choose **Volcano (Dragon/Fire)**, then only stage 1 and non-evolution Pokemon with the Dragon __or__ Fire type will spawn until changed or reset.

To change/reset your zone, simply run the **/changezone** command again and make the choice you wish to use.

Trainer.Name: daily
Trainer.ShortString: Claim a small reward every day.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/daily**

This command gives the user 10 Pokeballs and $200 every day, resetting at mignight UTC. If you have space in your inventory, it will also give you an egg to **/hatch** (more information through **/help eggs**). It will also give a link to upvote the bot on top.gg!

Trainer.Name: delete
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/delete**

This command is used to remove all data related to this trainer within the current server. The user can always run **/starter** to begin their journey anew!

Trainer.Name: inventory
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/inventory**

This command displays 4 different pages of items in the users inventory:
- Pokeballs
- Potions
- Candy
- Evolution Items

Trainer.Name: modifyteam
Trainer.ShortString: Add or replace a member of your battle team.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/modifyteam *[pokemon]***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - (Optional) Name of Pokemon to add to the team.

This command has two operations and will bring up two dropdowns.

The first operation happens when you do not provide a name with the command. This is treated as modifying just your existing team members. One example is you wish to change which Pokemon is in your first team slot for battles. In this case, the first selection dropdown will consist of only your team members. It will contain their expanded name (gender and shiny included) as well as all other relevant stats. The second selection will be your current team alignment. This will tell you what Pokemon is currently in which slot. You may choose a slot to replace with the first selected team member, or there will be an option to remove the selected member entirely.
NOTE: You must always have at least one Pokemon in your battle team.

The second operation is providing the name filter when issuing the command. This is used to add a Pokemon from your box to the team either by addition or replacement. With this command path, there will still be two selection dropdowns. However, this time the first selection will only be Pokemon not currently in the team with the name given through the filter. The selection choices will contain information about the Pokemon such as their expanded name (gender and shiny included) as well as all other relevant stats. The second selection will contain allcurrent team members with their details as well. If the current team is not full (6 members), there will be an additional selection named 'Add To End Slot', which will do exactly as it says. You may choose a current team member and replace them in that slot, or add the selected Pokemon to the last available slot on your team (if applicable).

Trainer.Name: myeggs
Trainer.ShortString: View your current egg list in list or image format.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/myeggs *[images]***
Parameters:
**images** - (Optional) Display egg images instead of a list.

This command will display the eggs currently in your inventory, sorted by the order in which you obtained them. Information displayed on each page can contain their name, current progress, and what rarity they will hatch into. A âœ…checkmark will be placed next to any eggs that are ready to **/hatch**.

You may also see the short-hand list through **/trainer**. For more information on eggs use **/help eggs**

Trainer.Name: myteam
Trainer.ShortString: View your current battle team in detailed image format.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/myteam**

This command will display your current battle team in the order of slot placement. Information displayed on each page will contain their expanded name (gender, shiny, and level included), experience, height/weight, typing, and if they can currently evolve. To change your team, use the **/modifyteam** command.

Trainer.Name: mypokemon
Trainer.ShortString: Displays the current or given users owned Pokemon.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/mypokemon *[pokemon]* *[type]* *[image]* *[order]* *[shiny]* *[legendary]* *[gender]* *[@user]***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - (Optional) Only show this Pokemon.
**type** - (Optional) Only show Pokemon with this type.
**image** - (Optional) Whether the list should be shown in image format.
**order** - (Optional) How the list should be ordered.
**shiny** - (Optional) Choose if shiny Pokemon are specially sorted.
**legendary** - (Optional) Choose to show or exclude Legendary/Mythicals.
**gender** - (Optional) Choose to only show Male/Female.
**@user** - (Optional) View another server members list.

This command will display the current (or given) users current Pokemon collection in a text list form by default. Using the options above, you can format and change the returned list to your liking.

__Examples__
**/mypokemon images:Yes** - Display the current (or given) users Pokemon in a carousel image format with default ordering and no special shiny sorting.

**/mypokemon order:Name shiny:Shiny First** - Display Pokemon in a text list and sort the list by name. Shiny Pokemon will be displayed and sorted by name at the front of the list.
```Gloomâœ¨
Vulpixâœ¨
Abra
Blaziken
Zubat```

**/mypokemon  order:National Dex shiny:Shiny Only** - Displays the list in sorted order by National Dex number and only displays owned shinies.

Trainer.Name: release
Trainer.ShortString: Release one or many of the selected Pokemon.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/release *pokemon***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - Name of the Pokemon species you own that you wish to release.

This command will bring up a single dropdown listing all variations of the selected Pokemon outside of your set team. The selection list will contain a maximum of 25 Pokemon, so if you own 30 Pidgeys it will display the first 25 in your box. You will see the level, hieght, weight, and types for each Pokemon listed. You may select one, a few, or all Pokemon listed.

**NOTE:** You cannot release a Pokemon currently in your team. You must change it out using **/modifyteam** first.

Trainer.Name: trainer
Trainer.ShortString: Displays stats about the current or given user.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/trainer *[@user]***
Parameters:
**@user** - (Optional) View another server members statistics.

This command will give statistics regarding the trainer belonging to either yourself or the specified user. Information will be split into three different sections:
- Statistics
- Completion
- Other
Statistics will contains information such as current health, zone, and daily command status.
Completion will contain all Pokedex and Badge completion and percentages.
Other currently has Egg and Daycare usage information.

Trainer.Name: usepotion
Trainer.ShortString: Select a potion from your inventory to heal your trainer.
Trainer.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/usepotion *potion***
Parameters:
**potion** - Which type of potion to heal yourself with.

This command is how you can heal your trainer health using the Potions within your inventory. If your trainer is at full health, it will notify you and not use your potion. To see your current Potions, use the **/trainer** command. To buy more potions, use the **/shop** command.

__Healing__
**Potion** - 10 HP
**Super Potion** - 40 HP
**Hyper Potion** - 80 HP
**Max Potion** - 100 HP

Gym.Name: gymbattle
Gym.ShortString: Fight the next gym leader on your journey.
Gym.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/gymbattle**

This command will automatically determine the next gym leader for your journey. The fight will consist of the current trainers battle team, which can be modified through **/modifyteam**, and the gym leaders battle team. You may see information about any gym leader by using the **/gyminfo** command. In order for the challenge to be accepted, you must have enough money that if you lose, you are able to pay. This amount is equal to half the reward of the gym leader.

When challenge is accepted for a gym to battle, there is a chance for experience, money, and a gym badge. Fighting results are based off of 3 different comparisons in the process:
- Typing Matchup
- Rarity
- Pokemon level (not all cases)

The gym battle will start from the first slot of each team, eliminating one Pokemon per round until a team is wiped out. Example of a battle seen below. More details on how the fights work can be seen by using the **/help fight** command.

When fighting gym leaders, the trainer does not lose HP, unlike fighting wild Pokemon. During the fights, Pokemon will gain experience for each gym member they defeat. Only the Pokemon that defeats the opponent will get experience. The amount of experience is based on the opponents level multiplied by **5x**. Exp. Share does NOT contribute during gym fights.

__Example Fight:__
```ansi
| [0;31mGardevoir[0m | [0;37mStaryu[0m  |
|   [0;31mAxew[0m    | [0;37mStaryu[0m  |
|  [0;37mLeafeon[0m  | [0;31mStaryu[0m  |  
|  [0;31mLeafeon[0m  | [0;37mStarmie[0m |
|  [0;31mNuzleaf[0m  | [0;37mStarmie[0m |```

NOTE: You can simulate a battle between two Pokemon using **/battlesim** for more details.

Gym.Name: gyminfo
Gym.ShortString: Display information about a specified gym leader.
Gym.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/gyminfo *leader***
Parameters:
**leader** - Which gym leader to display.

This command provides the trainer information about a former or upcoming gym leader. During the command entry, a list of gym leaders will be provided with the next leader on the trainers journey labeled. The default information given is a image of the gym leader and their badge, the type of gym they are, and the reward for defeating them. If you have already attempted to battle the gym leader, there will be another page available that displays their battle team.

NOTE: You may also filter by region when running the command.

Trade.Name: trade
Trade.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/trade *user* *give* *receive***
Parameters:
**user** - Target user to trade with.
**give** - Pokemon you wish to trade away.
**receive** - Pokemon you wish to receive.

The **/trade** command is a simple interaction that allows trainers to trade a single Pokemon between each other. You will input the user to trade with, the name of what you wish to give up, and the name of what you wish to receive.

Two selection boxes will show up, one for the specific Pokemon to give away, and one for the specific Pokemon to receive in the trade.
__NOTE__: Pokemon currently in a team can NOT be traded.

Once the trade is submitted, a ping message will be sent asking the target user if they accept the trade, showing details of each Pokemon selected (level, height, weight, color, typing). If the target user accepts, the Pokemon are traded and the Pokedex of each user is updated.

Shop.Name: shop
Shop.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/shop**

Provides the trainer with the ability to buy items from the shop, or sell items from their inventory.

To purchase an item, select the 'Buy' option. When purchasing items, the only possible choices are what is affordable, your current funds displayed above the cancel and submit buttons (i.e. If the trainer has $300, they will NOT see Ultraball, Hyper Potion, or Max Potion). The selections will have the prices labeled next to their names. After selecting the item, they may choose how many they wish to buy. Again, it will only allow you to buy what you can afford.

To sell items, select the 'Sell' option on the dirst dropdown. The second dropdown will populate with the current items in your inventory and their sale price. Once an item is selected, it will ask how many you wish to sell.

After either operation, you will receive a confirmation of the sale and your new current funds.

Shop.Name: specialshop
Shop.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/specialshop**

Provides the trainer with the ability to buy special evolution items from a rotating daily shop, or sell the evolution items they already own.

To purchase an item, select the 'Buy' option. When purchasing items, the only possible choices are what is affordable, your current funds displayed above the cancel and submit buttons. The selections will have the prices labeled next to their names. Special items can only be bought once per rotation, and only one of each item is available.

To sell items, select the 'Sell' option on the dirst dropdown. The second dropdown will populate with the current items in your inventory and their sale price. Once an item is selected, it will ask how many you wish to sell.

After either operation, you will receive a confirmation of the sale and your new current funds.

A new rotation of the shop will be available every day at midnight UTC.

Pokemon.Name: battlesim
Pokemon.ShortString: Simulate a wild/gym battle between two Pokemon.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/battlesim *battle* *attacker* *defender***
Parameters:
**battle** - Specify wild or gym battle.
**attacker** - Pokemon on the offensive.
**battle** - Defending Pokemon.

BattleSim will help trainers understand the intricacies of Pokemon battles within PokeTrainer. There are three sections which will help understand a specific matchup between the Pokemon selected:
- Type Matchup
- Rarity Matchup
- Level Assistance
Each section will provide details as to what calculations would happen and a possible outcome for the given battle.

Pokemon.Name: daycare
Pokemon.ShortString: Up to two Pokemon will gain passive experience over time.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/daycare *[pokemon]***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - (Optional) Name filter of the Pokemon you wish to add to the daycare.

Daycare is another way for your Pokemon to gain experience. This is a passive gain that is purely time-based, gaining 10 XP every hour they are in the Daycare.

You may only have up to two Pokemon stored in the Daycare at a time. You may add a Pokemon to the Daycare by specifying what Pokemon to add while running the command. To check on and remove Pokemon from the Daycare, run the command without any specifications.

__NOTE__: There are currently no Eggs obtainable from the Daycare.

Pokemon.Name: evolve
Pokemon.ShortString: Evolve one of your Pokemon that are eligible.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/evolve *[pokemon]***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - (Optional) Name filter of the Pokemon you wish to evolve.

When you own a Pokemon that meets its criteria for evolution, this command is used to actually do the evolution step. To see the criteria needed, check out **/help evolution** which will contain much more detail. After running the evolve command, you will be prompted with 2 select menus. The first menu will be all available options for evolution (filtered if the parameter is given), up to 25 different selections. Once the first option is selected, the second menu will contain all available evolution options for the initial Pokemon to evolve into (i.e. If Oddish is chosen to evolve, the second list will contain Gloom). You may evolve any Pokemon that you own, including any members of your party.

Pokemon.Name: givecandy
Pokemon.ShortString: Give an experience candy to one of your Pokemon.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/givecandy *[pokemon]***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - (Optional) Name filter of the Pokemon you wish to receive a candy.

Candies are a way to gain experience points and levels for your Pokemon. Currently there are only three different candies:
- Small Candy: 15 experience
- Large Candy: 40 experience
- Rare Candy: 1 Level
You can purchase candies through the **/shop** and view how many you currently own through **/trainer**.

Pokemon.Name: hatch
Pokemon.ShortString: Hatch your eggs that are ready.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/hatch**

Once your eggs reach the required **/spawn** count (see **/help eggs** for more information), this command will actually hatch them and provide your new Pokemon. This will provide you with a select list of all hatchable eggs that you can do at the same time. Hatching an egg also gives you **$50** towards your trainer. Eggs also have a re-roll for a âœ¨shinyâœ¨!

Current egg progress can be seen through **/myeggs** or **/trainer**. Remember, you cannot throw eggs away, so make sure you hatch them!

Pokemon.Name: nickname
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/nickname *pokemon***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - Which Pokemon you would like to nickname

This command gives you the opportunity to nickname one of your Pokemon. After providing which Pokemon you would like to nickname, it will give you a selection of all the versions of that Pokemon you own (up to 25) in which you would select one to nickname.

Once you select the specific Pokemon, you may nickname it whatever you like up to **20 characters**. If you provide a blank nickname, it will go back to using the default Pokemon name.

Pokemon.Name: pokedex
Pokemon.ShortString: Displays the current or given users owned Pokemon.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/pokedex *[@user]* *[dex]* *[pokemon]***
Parameters:
**@user** - (Optional) View another server members list.
**dex** - (Optional) Which Dex to view progress for
**pokemon** - (Optional) Specific Pokemon to check Dex status for.

The **/pokedex** command will display the current (or given) users current Pokedex data in a text list format. Using the options above, you can change which Dex to view the information for, the different lists being:
- **Pokedex**: Normal dex based on the default Pokedex ID
- **Form Dex**: Special Pokedex that treats different forms separate (i.e. Meowth vs. Alolan Meowth
- **Shiny Dex**: Similar to the Form Dex, but for shiny Pokemon

If you specify a Pokemon, it will show you the regular and shiny form status for the selected dex, as well as details about the Pokemon if you have it registered in your regular Pokedex. If you select Shiny Dex and specify a Pokemon, the Checkmark will default to Form Dex.

__Examples__
**/pokedex** - Display the current (or given) users Pokedex in a list format, checkmarks indicating what is registered.
**/pokedex dex:Form Dex** - Display the Form Dex in a list format, checkmarks indicating what is registered.
**/pokedex dex:Pokedex pokemon:Diglett** - Displays two Diglett pages, one non-shiny with a checkmark and details if you have captured Diglett or Alolan Diglett, and one shiny with a checkmark if you have captured that specific forms shiny.

Pokemon.Name: pokeinfo
Pokemon.ShortString: Displays Pokemon information for the specified search.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/pokeinfo *search* *filter***
Parameters:
**search** - Which kind of search to perform.
**filter** - The filter based on the search provided.

This command is a way for trainers to look at what Pokemon species belong to different groups. There are 2 different options to search for:

__Pokemon By Color__
The filter for this search will be all color classifications that a Pokemon can have (such as *blue*, *red*, etc.). The color of a Pokemon is based on the Color filter within **Pokemon HOME**. The result of this search will be a text-based list of Pokemon names that belong in the selected color group, sorted by name.

You may see some oddities, such as Alolan Rattata being grouped with *purple*. This is because **Pokemon Home** classifies each Pokemon based on the *species*, and both Rattata and Alolan Rattata are of the same *Rattata* species, which base color is purple.

__Pokemon By Type__
The filter will consist of all the different types a Pokemon can be. Once the type is selected, a list of text-based Pokemon names belonging to the type will be shown. They will also have their types listed, and will be sorted by solo typing, selected type being the main type, then selected typing being the secondary type:
Example: **/pokeinfo type:Dragon**```Axew (Dragon)
Bagon (Dragon)
...
Altaria (Dragon/Flying)
Arctibax (Dragon/Ice)
...
Alolan Exeggutor (Grass/Dragon)
Kingdra (Water/Dragon)
...```

Pokemon.Name: pokeshop
Pokemon.ShortString: Obtain an Legendary Pokemon in a currency exchange.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/pokeshop *pokemon***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - Which Legendary Pokemon you would like.

This command is a way for trainers to obtain a desired Legendary/Mythical/Ultra Beast Pokemon through economic means rather than adventure. Every Pokemon obtained through the **/pokeshop** will be at **Level 1**. Pokemon can be obtained in exchange for money and Masterballs, listed below:
- __Regular Legendary__: **$100000** + **20x Masterball**
- __Shiny Legendary__: **$200000** + **30x Masterball**

Pokemon.Name: spawn
Pokemon.ShortString: Spawn a Pokemon that you may capture or fight.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/spawn**

Spawning is how trainers can grow their collection through capturing, or earn money and experience through fighting. When the **/spawn** command is run, there are a few factors that go into the spawn calculation. The first factor to be considered is the spawn rarity, then there are some exclusions (including your zone types from **/changezone**), and finally there are numbers crunched for shiny odds and other details.

__Rarity__
More information can be seen through the **/help rarity** command. Only certain rarities can spawn through the basic command: 1, 2, and 3 (no evolution). This means only first stage Pokemon can spawn through the command.
Ex. Oddish, Smeargle, and Sentret can spawn, but not Weepinbell or Arcanine

__Exclusions__
There are exclusions that will not be found during a regular spawn. Here is a list of Pokemon types that do not spawn:
- Mega forms
- Ultra Beasts
- Paradox
- Fossils
- Legendaries/Mythicals
- Starters.

__Details__
Some details that are calculated during the spawn process are *shiny rate*, *height/weight*, and *female chance*
- **Shiny Rate** - Currently set at 1/3000
- **Height/Weight** - +/- 10% of the average stat seen from **/pokeinfo**
- **Gender** - Each Pokemon has a stat out of 8 to be female.
Icons on a spawn will be as such:
- âœ…: You have this Pokedex entry already registered
- â˜‘ï¸: You have this specific form already registered
- ðŸŸ¦/ðŸŸ¥: The gender of the current spawn
- âœ¨: If the current spawn is a shiny

Every spawn will have 4 buttons attached: Pokeball, Greatball, Ultraball, and Fight. The Pokeballs are used for capturing, while the fight button is used for....fighting! An explanation for each can be seen through **/help capture** and **/help fight**.

Pokemon.Name: wishlist
Pokemon.ShortString: Add to or view your special spawn wishlist.
Pokemon.HelpString:
Proper command usage: **/wishlist *[pokemon]***
Parameters:
**pokemon** - (Optional) What Pokemon to add to your wishlist.

The main purpose of a wish list is to inform users when a specific Pokemon spawns during an event. One example: if Turtwig is in your wish list and a Turtwig event begins, you will get a ping within the thread of the event to notify you.

There are two functionalities when using **/wishlist**:
- View/remove from your current wish list
- Add to your wish list

__Viewing/Removing__
To view your current wish list, you must use the **/wishlist** command WITHOUT specifying a Pokemon. If you have a populated wish list, it will display a carousel of base images for each Pokemon within your list. There will also be a button to **remove** a Pokemon you no longer want in your wish list.

__Adding__
To add a Pokemon into your wish list, run the **/wishlist [pokemon]** command. The Pokemon specified will be added to your list and will now notify you when spawned. The limits for addition are:
- Only 5 Pokemon in your wish list maximum
- You may not add a Pokemon twice
- Only special spawn Pokemon may be added (legendaries, fossil, starters, etc.)

Actions.Name: capture
Actions.HelpString:
With every Pokemon wild spawn, there are three different buttons to try and capture. The three correspond to:
ðŸ”´ - Pokeball, ðŸ”µ - Greatball, ðŸŸ¡ - Ultraball

For a capture to be successful, the trainer must choose one of the ball buttons and have at least one of the chosen ball in their inventory, able to be checked with the **/trainer** command.

The success of a capture is based on a few things:
- Capture rate of the Pokemon (**/pokeinfo**)
- Ball used to capture
- Level (only levels 13 and below)
- Pokemon are treated as half HP
The math behind this is a bit much to explain in help docs, but it is vaguely based off of the real capture success rates. You will find similar numbers crunching through the real equations with the same data.

Actions.Name: eggs
Actions.HelpString:
Every time you use the **/daily** command, you will receive an egg. There are three different levels of eggs you can obtain: Level One, Level Two, Special.

__Level One Egg__
- These eggs have a 75% chance of being obtained from a **/daily** roll.
- These take 100 **/spawn** interactions to become ready to hatch.
- They will hatch into any First Stage Pokemon in an evolution chain, including fossils and starters but NOT including legendaries.

__Level Two Egg__
- These eggs have a 24% chance of being obtained from a **/daily** roll.
- These take 150 **/spawn** interactions to become ready to hatch.
- They will hatch into any Pokemon without an evolution line, NOT including legendaries.

__Special Egg__
- These eggs have a 1% chance of being obtained from a **/daily** roll.
- These take 200 **/spawn** interactions to become ready to hatch.
- They will hatch into any First Stage Legendary Pokemon in an evolution chain.


You can only have 5 total eggs in your inventory, and cannot get rid of them. When they reach their interaction amount, use the **/hatch** command to get your new Pokemon at level 1.

Eggs also have a re-roll for a âœ¨shinyâœ¨!

Actions.Name: events
Actions.HelpString:
There are two different kinds of events: Special Trainers and Special Spawns. (More coming soon!)
Event times are at: 02:00, 08:00, 14:00, and 20:00 UTC

**__Special Trainers__**
These events will have a random trainer appear looking to battle! Any trainer may be fought by any trainer, but each trainer can only attempt to fight **one single time**. If the trainer is victorious, they will receive the reward stated on the event message. Rewards can range from just regular money to special evolution items. Fights for these special trainers are different from wild/gym battles. Look at **/help fight** for more details.

**__Special Spawns__**
This is where you can get Pokemon not obtainable through the means of **/spawn**. Categories include: starters, fossil Pokemon, Ultra Beasts, Paradox, and Legendary/Mythical Pokemon. Whichever category spawns during this event can only be caught with a __Masterball__.

Actions.Name: evolution
Actions.HelpString:
Evolution in PokeTrainer is based very much off of the base games (Gen 8+). However, the only evolution types that PokeTrainer will look at are:
- Level
- Gender
- Items
The only difference is that oddities such as *Friendship* or *Day-Cycle* evolutions are changed to be based on Level instead.

There are also some evolution lines that will randomly evolve based on the requirements. Some example are:
- Eevee (Lvl.25) -> Espeon | Umbreon | Sylveon
- Pikachu (Thunder Stone) -> Raichu | Alolan Raichu
Random evolving is only for Pokemon that have two or more evolutions that have the same requirement.

Items for evolution can be bought through the rotating **/help specialshop** that recycles daily.

The amount of experience required for a level is based off of the Pokemons current level, evolution stage, and evolution requirement.

__3-Stage Evolution__
- Stage 1: 50xp
- Stage 2: 150xp
- Stage 3: 250xp

__2-Stage Evolution__
- Stage 1: 100xp
- Stage 2: 250xp

__No Evolution/Legendaries__
- All Levels: 200xp

When a Pokemon passes the level requirement for it's evolution, it's required experience per level actually increases to the next stage
- Ex. A Lvl. 18 Charmander will require 150xp per level

Actions.Name: fight
Actions.HelpString:
There are three types of fights that a trainer can partake in: trainer fights, wild fights and gym battles.

**__Trainer Fights__**
Special Trainers may arrive during event spawns and will use this style of fighting to determine who is victorious. There will be a fight (âš”ï¸) reaction to initiate the fight with your current team. If you lose the fight, there is no penalty but you will not be able to challenge the trainer again.

Similar to the other fights, rarity, type matchup, and level are all used to determine which Pokemon wins each match. However, in these fights it goes both ways. This means each Pokemon will take a "turn" fighting and based on who has the more favorable outcome, a victor will be shown. There is not **/battlesim** for these fights, but you can get a vague idea by simulating a wild fight. Levels for the opponents Pokemon will be given during events.

NOTE: If the event fights work out as planned, this fighting style will be used for trainer vs trainer battles in the future!

**__Wild Fight__**
When a Pokemon spawns, there is a reaction available to fight it (âš”ï¸). This will provide money ($25) and experience to the Pokemon you choose to fight. You must have some amount of HP to expend for a fight to occur, the command will warn you if your HP is low.

Fighting results are based off of 3 different comparisons: typing matchup, level, and rarity. When a trainer fights a wild Pokemon, they are always on the offensive. This means every typing check is based off of the trainer's Pokemon being the attacker and the wild Pokemon being the defender.

Losing 10hp or more will consider the battle lost and will reward no experience or money.

NOTE: Pokemon levels can reduce/increase the amount of health lost depending on the scale.

**__Gym Battle__**
When you trigger a gym battle by using **/gymbattle**, the fight is slightly different compared to a wild fight. It does not cost HP to fight a gym leader, but money instead. More can be seen through **/help gymbattle**.

The fight results are based off of similar comparisons: typing matchup and rarity, with level being a last resort factor in most cases. Gym Leader Levels are as such:
- First Stage: **Level 15**
- Second Stage/No Evolution: **Level 25**
- Final Stage: **Level 35**
- Voltage Gym: **Level 100**
The gym battle will start from the first slot of each team, eliminating one Pokemon per round until a team is wiped out.


For a deeper dive on fights, you can use **/battlesim** to mock a wild or gym battle.

Actions.Name: lock
Actions.HelpString:
Due to how the data of PokeTrainer is kept and updated, there were ways to circumvent certain actions and "rewind" time to a previous state. Locks for commands have been put in place so that if you are using a command that has the potential to edit your data, it will prevent you from using another command of the same nature.

Due to this now being in place **DO NOT DISMISS MESSAGES** instead of using the interaction buttons. If you do, there is a possibility that you will be locked from using certain commands for up to **5 minutes**.

If you experience any issue, please report them to the [Discord Server](https://discord.com/invite/W9T4K7fyYu).

Actions.Name: missions
Actions.HelpString:
Trainers will have access to both Daily and Weekly missions to give out rewards upon completion. To receive either mission, use the **/daily** command, and to view them and their current status use the **/trainer** command. Details for each seen below.

__Daily Missions__
These missions are given out during every **/daily** reset (00:00 UTC). The following list are possibilities of what a daily mission can be:
- Catch a number of Pokemon (may be type specific)
- Battle a number of Pokemon (may be type specific)
- Evolve a Pokemon
- Release a number of Pokemon
- Trade a Pokemon
- Attempt a **/gymbattle**
The reward for completing a daily mission is **3x Rare Candy**.

__Weekly Missions__
These missions are refreshed every Monday (00:00 UTC) by using the **daily** command. The following are a list of possible missions:
- Catch a number of Pokemon
- Battle a number of Pokemon
- Evolve a number of Pokemon
- Release a number of Pokemon
- Trade a number of Pokemon
The reward for completing a weekly mission is **1x Masterball**.

Actions.Name: rarity
Actions.HelpString:
Rarity is best described as how rare a Pokemon is to be chosen during a **/spawn** command. There are 5 different levels of rarity (not including legendaries):
```Level 1 - Stage 1 of a 3-stage evolution.
- Examples: Pidgey, Nidoran.
Level 2 - Stage 1 of a 2-stage evolution.
- Examples: Onix, Eevee.
Level 3 - Stage 2 of a 3-stage evolution OR a Pokemon without an evolution.
- Examples: Lapras, Haunter.
Level 4 - Final stage of a 2-stage evolution.
- Examples: Gyarados, Weezing.
Level 5 - Final stage of a 3-stage evolution.
- Examples: Victreebel, Dragonite.```
Rarity is calculated based on if there are evolutions preceeding or succeeding the current Pokemon, and how many. Two normal examples are the Pidgey/Fearow lines:
```Pidgey (1) ---> Pidgeotto (3) ---> Pidgeot (5)

Spearow (2) ---> Fearow (4)```
One strange example is the Mime Jr. line:
```             ---> Mr. Mime (4)
Mime Jr. (1) |
             ---> Galarian Mr. Mime (3) ---> Mr. Rime (5)```
Mime Jr. is considered a rarity 1 because it's the initial stage and its maximum chain is 3 evolutions. Mr. Mime is considered rarity 4 because it's considered the final evolution in a 2-stage chain.

During battles, Pokemon are placed into something called __rarity groups__. These are based on the initial rarity of the Pokemon:
```Rarity Group 1: Stage 1 Pokemon (Rarity 1/2)
- Examples: Pidgey, Spearow

Rarity Group 2: Middle or No Evolution Pokemon (Rarity 3)
- Examples: Pidgeotto, Lapras

Rarity Group 3: Final Stage Pokemon (Rarity 4/5)
- Examples: Pidgeot, Fearow

Legendaries have their own grouping based on their high rarities (8/9/10)```

Actions.Name: regionreward
Actions.HelpString:
Completing a regions gym gauntlet will provide you with extra rewards to help along in your journey. There is also a wild Pokemon progression as you go.

__Wild Encounters__
For every *2 Gym Badges* that you obtain, the level ranges of your wild encounters will increase.
Ex. At the beginning, first stage wild Pokemon have a range of Lvl.3-7. After 10 gym badges are obtained, they will now be spawning at Lvl.8-12.
This scaling goes all the way through the last official region.

__Region Rewards__
- Kanto: Exp. Share for your second team slot on wild encounters
- Johto: Higher chance for better eggs on a **/daily** call
- Hoenn: 10% chance to automatically win a wild fight and lose 0hp
- Sinnoh: 5% chance to critical success catch any wild Pokemon with any ball
- Unova: Upgrade **/daily** to 20 Pokeballs and $500
- Kalos: Increase **/daycare** slots to 4
- Galar: Increase **/myeggs** slots to 8
- Paldea: Your entire team gains experience when you capture a Pokemon
- Voltage: Increase your shiny odds on **/spawn** and **/hatch**

Actions.Name: update
Actions.HelpString:
__4/29/2024__
- You can now **/nickname** your Pokemon! Check out **/help nickname** for more details
- When viewing **/mypokemon**, the *name* sort will use a Pokemon's nickname if they have one
- Add two new filters to **/mypokemon** for specific *Pokemon* and *Type*. Check out **/help mypokemon** for more details
- Behind-the-scenes architecture changes to determine hidden/public commands

__4/30/2024__
- Add two new filters to **/mypokemon** for *Legendary* and *Gender*. Check out **/help mypokemon** for more details
- Fixed a bug for stat comparison events
- Re-architecture around event submission

__5/13/2024__
- You can now view all items in the **/shop** and **/specialshop** regardless if you can afford them
- Updated the autofill for **/gyminfo** to show your next gym leader first in the list
- Update **/gyminfo** to now show the badge image as well
- You may now view a gym leaders team if you have attempted the fight at least once
- Fixed an issue with **/gyminfo**
- Legendary Pokemon no longer ignore type matchups for wild encounters. Rather, you lose 1 less HP when using a fully evolved Legendary
- Command **/battlesim** updated to reflect new Legendary battle rules

5/17/2024
- Added a **/wishlist** for special spawn events. Use **/help wishlist** for more details
- After attempting a gym leader for the first time, you only get 2x experience instead of 5x
- Servers without correct event permissions will be automatically unregistered. View permissions through **/help register**

__6/5/2024__
- New Daily/Weekly Missions! Use **/help missions** for more details
- Capturing a Pokemon no longer gives money as a reward (including event spawns)
- Failing to capture a Pokemon will now cost HP, making higher tier Pokeballs more effective
- Defeating a spawned Pokemon now gives $25 instead of $50
- Removed the 'Run Away' reaction from spawns
- Stat comparisons and Pokemon Counts events have been Removed
- New Special Trainers will now appear during event times

__7/5/2024__
- Refactored some daily missions. Removed (No Zone) requirements
- Fixed an error with trading using improper parameters
- Removed the ping for participating in events. Watch list pings are still present

__7/23/2024__
- Added a **/pokeshop**. Check out **/help pokeshop** for more details

__Newest Update (7/24/2024)__
- Removed ??? Arceus from the **/pokeshop**
- You can no longer see Gym Leader details just for attempting the battle
- Added more region rewards. Check out **/help regionreward** for more details

__Newest Update (8/18/2024)__
- To prevent loopholes in terms of random evolutions, temporary locks have been put in place. Use **/help commandlock** for more information
- A new command has been added to **/delete** your trainer. Use **/help delete** for more information
